title: Chauncey O'Toole
text:
Chauncey O'Toole (born 22 February 1986 in <a href="Saint%20John%2C%20New%20Brunswick">Saint John, New Brunswick</a>) is a Canadian former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. O'Toole played any position across the back-row but his preferred position was at openside flanker. O'Toole made his debut for the Canadian national men's team against <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> on 23 May 2009.
Chauncey O'Toole was raised in Belleisle, New-Brunswick. He attended <a href="Belleisle%20Regional%20High%20School">Belleisle Regional High School</a>, where he played rugby for the school team.
Chauncey O'Toole has previously played for the Belleisle Rovers, <a href="Castaway%20Wanderers%20RFC">Castaway Wanderers RFC</a>, <a href="RGC%201404">RGC 1404</a> in North Wales, and <a href="The%20Rock%20%28rugby%20team%29">the Rock</a> of the <a href="Canadian%20Rugby%20Championship">Canadian Rugby Championship</a>. In September 2010, O'Toole signed a short-term contract with the <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> as cover at a time when the club was plagued with injury. He was let go just a month later having played only one game for the Scottish side.
On 8 July 2011, Rugby Canada released its 30-man squad for the 2011 Rugby World Cup which included O'Toole as one of four flankers selected.
O'Toole joined <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a> side <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a> after the 2011 Rugby World Cup.
The Ospreys loaned O'Toole to feeder club <a href="Bridgend%20Ravens">Bridgend Ravens</a> on 5 November 2011 for their game against <a href="Newport%20RFC">Newport RFC</a>. O'Toole scored a try on his debut, in the dying seconds of the game to snatch the win for his adopted side by 2 points.
O'Toole was released by the Ospreys in July 2012.
O'Toole has since joined the ranks of the Saint John Fire Department. (2014)
